page.title: 07BRIGHSTONE PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: The village school was opened in 1836 and this makes it 149 years old. The original building still makes up the bulk of the school. It is built of stone. Later brick additions to the building also house the classrooms today. The school has children from the age of five to nine. Some four year olds are taken just before their fifth birthday. There are 104 pupils at the moment and four teachers including the headmaster. Schooldays start at 8.30am and end at 2.45pm. Most of the children do not have far to come as they live in the village. The children do netball, cricket and football. The school also has its own small swimming pool outside which is ideal for learners.
